item.title: Advent of Code 2024 - Day 7
item.description: Day 7 of #AdventOfCode 2024 was a complex problem set in a jungle, involving engineers calibrating a rope bridge and sneaky elephants. The challenge, “Bridge Repair,” required determining whether equations could be made true by inserting a combination of operators (+, *, and the new ||) into a series of numbers. While the problem itself was intriguing, it also introduced significant computational challenges, particularly with handling permutations and optimizing the process for large inputs.

item.title: Advent of Code 2024 - Day 5
item.description: Day 5 of #AdventOfCode 2024 involved helping the North Pole printing department solve a crucial issue with the sleigh launch safety manual updates. The puzzle, “Print Queue,” required us to ensure that the pages were printed in the correct order based on a set of dependencies, and then find the middle page number for correctly ordered updates. In Part 2, the task was to reorder any incorrect updates and compute the middle page numbers for those.

item.title: Advent of Code 2024 - Day 2
item.description:
Advent of Code 2024 - Day 2

Recently, I tackled Day 2 of the Advent of Code 2024â€”a coding challenge with a fascinating twist on data analysis and optimization. The task involved analyzing lists of numbers to determine if they were “safe” based on specific rules, with an additional complexity introduced in Part Two.

The Challenge

The puzzle required checking if:

  1. The numbers were either all increasing or all decreasing.
  2. Adjacent differences were between 1 and 3 (inclusive).

In Part Two, we could “tolerate a single bad level” by imagining one number removed, potentially transforming an unsafe report into a safe one.

item.title: Advent of Code 2024 - Day 1
